answers.answer: Thank you for your question. Her symptoms could be most likely suggestive of diabetic neuropathy although without being able to examine you I can not be precise on diagnosis. Symptoms may start with numbness, tingling, or pain in the legs and proceed to weakness & wasting of the muscles of the legs. Sometimes these symptoms could be severe & sudden as well. In addition, if she is suffering continuous weakness and notice reduced strength of muscle bulk in leg, please arrange an appointment with a neurologist right away. Neurologist would like to clinically examine her and order some investigations like nerve conduction studies or electromyography to reach at probable diagnosis here. Hope this helps.

question: My mom is 82 old yeaes,having diabetes for 30 year.Her glucose is quite OK with normal. Now she feels left leg pain for 1 week.without help from others, she cannot walk,complainting for pain. no sympton of fracture, no joint pain. please give me suggestion
title: diabetes with leg pain
